text: ♫Gonna smoke me a fatty brisket
♫I got my barbecue shoes on
♫Gonna smoke me a fatty brisket
♫I got my barbecue shoes on

♫Got my natural casing,
got the hogs on the run!♫
(lively saxophone music)
- [Voiceover] Welcome to bbqpitboys.com.

Today we're cooking up
an open fire breakfast
at the pit and it's real easy to do.
All right, there is nothing like eating
breakfast out at an open fire, right?
It brings on good things, good life

and like I said, this
recipe's real easy to do.

You're going to start
out with some peppers.
You're going to need some onions for this.
You're going to need some mushrooms,

some garden fresh tomatoes,
some free range eggs.

Oh man, how about some
baked ham and sirloin steak?
This is going to be good.

Now, here we're chopping
up the veges of course
and you can find the exact ingredients
on our website, bbqpitboys.com, what else.

And you just want to prep
your veges, chop them up
in relatively small pieces just like that.
And you want to get yourself a fire
going right; kind of a low medium heat.

All right, the veges are
cut, now we've got some ham.

This is a baked ham, this
is already precooked.
You can pretty much get these everywhere.
And we're just going to cut them
up again in some small pieces.
And here we've got some sirloin steak.

We're going to throw
this in the pan as well.

Now of course, you can
do it the way you want.

You can just go with the
steak or just go with the ham
or like what we're doing here we're
putting both together, oh man.

Now, we're going to put a
little S-P-G on the steak.
Use what condiments you like.

All right, the fire is going;
we want a real low heat.
We don't want to burn this now, right?

And we're going to, in
this 12 inch black iron pan
add a little bit of cooking oil
and we're going to sear the meat.
Get that steak going in there, oh yeah.
Oh man, you getting hungry or what?
(chuckles)
All right, do a quick sear.

That'll bring on some
texture, some flavor.
Oh yeah.
There's nothing like kicking back
at the pit and eating on some good food.
Oh baby.

All right, the steak and the
ham have been seared briefly
and now we're going to throw in the veges.
Got about three peppers in there.

We've got about a half
a pound of mushrooms,
two or three garden fresh tomatoes.

We've got some garlic
in there, ooh whee man.
You smell that? It smells good!
(chuckles)

All right, now the idea here
is we're going to slowly
cook this on this black iron pan.
And get it to just about like that.

See how it's seared, the veges
have softened up real nice.

Now you don't want to
overcook this now, right?
All right, we've got the meat and
the veges the way we want it.
Now comes the free range eggs.
We've got about eight of them here.
Oh yeah.
(peppy guitar music)

Now if you've never done
one of these open fire

breakfasts before you definitely
got to check this out.
This will be enough energy to carry
you through a day, whatever you're doing,

hunting, fishing, or just
kicking back (chuckles).

All right, eggs are in.
I'm going to whip them.
And now we've got some Asiago cheese.
Use your favorite cheese, the Asiago works

real well for this, and
we're going to grate
in about a quarter pound of it.
(peppy guitar music)
Now we're going to pour the egg
mixture and cheese all over the top.
We want to make a single layer.
We don't want to work it into the meat
and the veges, just keep it on top.
And again, keep a real low heat on this.
You want to be careful you don't
burn it because of the cheese, right?
Slow simmer.
This smells good!
All right.
Take a look at that.
See how the egg and cheese have firmed up.

We use an old hick, pull it
away from the sides of the pan.
Oh man, breakfast pie right there.
(peppy guitar music)
All right, I say it's time to eat.
See how it's firmed up again, real nice.
Lord have mercy.
(peppy guitar music)
Steak, ham, peppers, onions, garlic,
tomatoes, eggs, cheese.

Nothing left to do now but
to kick back and eat it.
Now you can dress up this open
fire breakfast any way you like.
We've got some hot pepper sauce here
from monthlypepperbox.com.

And we do apologize for eating
in front of you like this

but we call this pit master
privilege (chuckles).
Never enough hot sauce.
(peppy guitar music)

So the next time you're
looking for a breakfast recipe

to serve up at your pit
check out bbqpitboys.com.
(crow cawing)
